article.headline: Here's what's coming to Hulu in July 2020, and what's leaving
article.body: Hulu's original programming is taking a bit of a summer break in July, with just two new releases on tap, though there are plenty of other previously aired series and movies being added. The big debut is "Palm Springs" (July 10), a "Groundhog Day"-esque existential romantic comedy starring Andy Samberg and Cristin Milioti, which earlier this year set the record for a movie sold at the Sundance Film Festival - $17,500,000.69 (it was the 69 cents that put it over). div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } The other original for the Disney DIS, +1.53%  -controlled streaming service is "Into the Dark: The Current Occupant" (July 17), the latest episode in the horror anthology, which features a psychotic man who believes he's the president. For More: What's streaming in July on Netflix | Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max | Disney+ Other notable additions in July include the brilliant mockumentary "Best in Show," the underrated comedy "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" and the WWII classic "A Bridge Too Far" (all July 1).What's coming in July 2020 July 1 1000-lb Sisters: Complete Season 1 (TLC) 90 Day Fiance: Before the 90 Days: Complete
